facts.1: Independence Day is celebrated on July 4th to commemorate the adoption of the Declaration of Independence in 1776.
facts.2: The day is marked by fireworks, parades, barbecues, and various patriotic displays.
facts.3: The Declaration of Independence was primarily authored by Thomas Jefferson.

facts.1: National Barbecued Spareribs Day is celebrated on July 4th to enjoy delicious barbecued spareribs.
facts.2: Barbecued spareribs are a popular dish in American cuisine, especially during summer cookouts.
facts.3: The day encourages people to fire up their grills and enjoy spareribs with family and friends.

facts.1: Sidewalk Egg Frying Day is observed on July 4th to test the old saying that it's hot enough to fry an egg on the sidewalk.
facts.2: The day is a fun and quirky way to celebrate the summer heat.
facts.3: While it may not be practical to fry an egg on the sidewalk, the day highlights the extreme temperatures of summer.
